heisig_chinese_memo: The heartbreak hotel has a stable with horses, and a wheat farm you can ride through with the horse to feel better.
Ru_trainchinese: wěn: (прил/глаг) устойчивый, стабильный, крепкий; (о человеке) степенный, надежный; точный, уверенный; делать стабильным, стабилизировать
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When the bag of wild rice gets left in the stable all of the horses get anxious because they are so hungry.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " He ", " Hidden " to save the sound. The original meaning is to destroy the grain to make it gather. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Stable, ravaged the valley to gather together. One said: An Ye. Conghe, hidden." It also means stability and stability, such as "Jin Shu. "Gu Kai's Biography": "Pedestrians are stable, and the sails are unharmed." Tang Dynasty Bai Juyi's "Dengxilou Yixingjian": "Sooner or later, I will return to the Xiaxia from the east, and take a boat across Qutang."

" Stable " means reliable and stable. For example, in Tang Dynasty Han Yu's "Answer to Hou Shengwen's Analects of Confucius": "This is a prudent statement, so please think more about it." "Zhu Zi Yu Lei. University Two. The Second Classics: "Sincere and honest, to pass this test, justice and rationality are stable. Otherwise, the 7th is a villain."

" Stable " means steady and calm. For example, Du Fu of the Tang Dynasty "Wei Saic Records Shizhaiguan Cao's Painting of Horses": "Poor nine horses compete for the gods and horses, and Gu Shiqing is high and stable." "Volume 11": "The act of being a widow is the most stable. People of this generation should not lead him in if there is nothing to do."

" Stable " also means to suspend action. For example, the third fold of Qin Jianfu's "Old Dongtang" in the Yuan Dynasty: "These two are so rude! Stabilize me in the tea room, he both left." "Journey to the West" Chapter 39: "You are slow Say something, but you can't stabilize him?"
humanum_short_description_en: From " He ", " Hidden " to save the sound. The original meaning is to destroy the grain to gather it, and it also means stability and stability.
humanum_full_description:
從「禾」，「隱」省聲。本義是蹂踐穀物使之聚集。《說文新附》：「穩，蹂穀聚也。一曰：安也。从禾，隱省。」又表示安穩、平穩，如《晉書．顧愷之傳》：「行人安穩，布帆無恙。」唐代白居易〈登西樓憶行簡〉：「早晚東歸來下峽，穩乘船舫過瞿唐。」

　　「穩」表示可靠、穩妥。如唐代韓愈〈答侯生問論語書〉：「此說甚為穩當，切更思之。」《朱子語類．大學二．經下》：「意誠、心正，過得此關，義理方穩。不然，七分是小人在。」

　　「穩」表示穩重、沉著。如唐代杜甫〈韋諷錄事宅觀曹將軍畫馬圖〉：「可憐九馬爭神駿，顧視清高氣深穩。」《二刻拍案驚奇．卷十一》：「居孀行徑，最宜穩重，此輩之人沒事不可引他進門。」

　　「穩」還表示使人暫緩行動。如元代秦簡夫《東堂老》第三摺：「這兩個好無禮也！把我穩在茶房裏，他兩個都走了。」《西遊記》第39回：「你就慢說些兒，卻不穩住他了？」
humanum_short_description: 從「禾」，「隱」省聲。本義是蹂踐穀物使之聚集，又表示安穩、平穩。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
穩 (Simplified: 稳)
Pinyin: wěn
English Definition: settled; steady; stable
Antonyms: 慌
Total strokes: 19; Radical: 禾
Pictophonetic: 㥯 indicates the sound; 禾 (grain) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 禾 [ hé ] cereal, grain, rice; plant, stalk
    • 㥯 [ yǐn ] careful, prudent; compassionate; grieved; worried
Example Words:
穩定 [ wěn dìng ]: steady; stable; stability; to stabilize; to pacify
穩步 [ wěn bù ]: steadily; a steady pace
穩健 [ wěn jiàn ]: firm; stable and steady
穩妥 [ wěn tuǒ ]: dependable
More: 穩* | *穩 | *穩*

穩字的基本解释

穩
wěn
见“稳”。

穩字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wěn］
［《廣韻》烏本切，上混，影。］
亦作“穏1”。“稳1”的繁体字。亦作“2”。
(1)平稳；安定。
(2)妥帖；工稳。
(3)安心；忍受。
(4)犹安顿。含有隐瞒真情，骗人暂缓行动的意思。
(5)匀称，适度。
(6)表示有把握。犹一定，准定。

穩字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【禾字部】　穩； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页861第14
【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】?烏本切，溫上聲。【說文】蹂穀聚也。一曰安也。从禾，隱省。古通用安隱。　又【字彙補】叶烏銑切，音偃。【蘇軾·垂雲亭詩】江山雖有餘，亭榭苦難穩。登臨不得要，萬象各偃蹇。

穩字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
穩字的起名意思

暂无。

stable
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wěn］
["Guangyun" U Benqie, upmix, shadow. ]
Also known as "Hang 1". Traditional Chinese characters for "stable 1". Also known as "2".
(1) Stable; stable.
(2) Appropriate; stable work.
(3) Peace of mind; endure.
(4) Still settled. Contains the meaning of concealing the truth and deceiving people to suspend action.
(5) Well-proportioned and moderate.
(6) It means to be sure. Certainly, surely.
stable
